common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Update and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Pieces OS and Desktop app updates failing, getting stuck, or not launching. This often occurs after updating to the latest version. Solutions include checking for OS updates, reinstalling the app, and verifying Pieces OS is running in the background. Some issues are resolved with specific app updates or by replacing corrupted app folders.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows 11 Home, 24H2

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces Desktop application has refused to launch since updating it to the latest version (v4.0.0). It's stuck in the "Ensure Core Dependencies" loading state even though I have Pieces OS already running successfully in the background. Kindly find screenshots below. 

I've tried force quitting both Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop from my Task Manager, uninstalling and re-installing Pieces Desktop, and restarting my PC, all to no avail. Any help would be highly appreciated, thank you!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/22c14a42-29d6-4a1f-ab34-51ba5074b38e)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/025d2e80-78be-480c-9cc2-a85a440dcf75)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/48c76dde-307a-4451-b85f-0483b74c2321)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* MoyinShabi is experiencing issues connecting Pieces for Developers to Pieces OS.
* The issue started after a recent update.
* MoyinShabi didn't receive any notification about a health check.

**Problems Identified:**

* Issues with the desktop app's database.
* Inability to reproduce the reported boot issue.
* A potential error with the GetIt flutter package.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mack-at-pieces requested log files and the "com.pieces.pfd" and "com.pieces.os" folders.
* Mack-at-pieces identified and fixed a bug in the "com.pieces.pfd" folder.
* A repaired "com.pieces.pfd" folder was provided for MoyinShabi to download and replace.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The repaired "com.pieces.pfd" folder did not resolve the issue for MoyinShabi.
* MoyinShabi identified a potential error with the GetIt flutter package.
* Further investigation and troubleshooting are needed.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop and Extension Conflicts and Launch Issues

common_issues.title: PiecesOS High CPU Usage and Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users are reporting high CPU usage and performance issues with PiecesOS, particularly after the LTM-2 update. The issue affects various applications like Discord, Slack, and Microsoft Edge, causing lag and slowdowns. While a hotfix was released, some users still experience problems. The Pieces team is actively investigating and working on optimization to address these issues. Users are encouraged to provide detailed feedback and reports to assist in resolving the problem.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Turning on Long Term Memory has been slowing down my desktop computer, even before LTM-2. After updating today, it still happens. It's most noticeable when I use Slack and Discord, and disabling those apps on LTM doesn't work. Even after switching the Processing Mode to Cloud, as suggested by HRA42 on the Discord server, the lag still occurs. At some point, the total CPU usage went up by over 90%.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eaef0d65-b19b-41f0-bf8a-f143fa8d1e43)

My computer specs:
- CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6300 CPU @ 3.80GHz
- RAM: DDR4 32 GB
- Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 2 GB

I'm yet to notice significant slowness on other programs, but if I'm getting a lot of lag on those chat apps, I can imagine I would get them too on something heavier like Visual Studio.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Issue:** High CPU usage on Pieces OS (specifically with Discord and Microsoft Edge)

**Key Points:**

- Issue reported by @epikkoder and others
- Issue persists after hotfix released on 2025-03-05
- Confirmed on Windows 10 & 11, various hardware configurations
- Primarily affecting Microsoft Edge and Discord
- LTM2 engine suspected to be the culprit

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- Hotfix released on 2025-03-05
- Another patch released on 2025-03-06

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- Issue partially resolved, but CPU usage still high, especially on Microsoft Edge
- Pieces team continues to investigate and improve the performance

**Actionable Next Steps:**

- Pieces team to continue working on fixing the remaining performance issues.
- Users experiencing the issue are encouraged to provide detailed feedback and reports to assist the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue: PiecesOS High Memory Usage

**Key Points Raised:**

* High memory usage of PiecesOS, ranging from 2GB to 5GB.
* Some users experience high CPU usage as well, up to 100% in some cases.
* Memory usage increases despite "Optimize Memory" option.
* The issue persists even with minimal model usage and no active development.

**Problems Identified:**

* High memory footprint of PiecesOS impacting system performance.
* Suspected memory leak causing uncontrolled memory consumption.
* Potential performance issues due to resource intensive processing and on-device ML capabilities.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Identified and replaced two heavy database technologies (PiecesOS 11.1.0 release).
* Implemented "Optimize Memory" feature to unload unused ML models.
* Continuous efforts to improve memory and CPU performance.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Memory usage after the 11.1.0 release is reported to be around 2GB with potential for further improvements.
* However, some users are still experiencing high CPU usage, particularly with LTM-2 update.
* Further investigation and optimization efforts are ongoing to address these issues.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was raised in April 2024 and is still open as of March 2025.
* While the initial issue of high memory usage has been partially addressed, CPU usage problems persist and require further attention.

recommendations: **Prioritize high-impact issues:** Focus on resolving the **Pieces OS and Desktop App Update and Launch Issues**, and **PiecesOS High CPU Usage and Performance Issues** as they have the highest frequency and are impacting a significant number of users.

**Investigate database and dependency issues:** Several tickets point to potential problems with the desktop app's database and dependency management (GetIt flutter package). Allocate resources to investigate and address these underlying technical issues.

**Improve communication around updates:** The update to Pieces OS and Desktop App (v4.0.0) caused several issues. Enhance communication about updates, including known issues, workarounds, and rollback options.

**Review antivirus compatibility:** Address the issue of antivirus software flagging Pieces OS updates as malicious.  Collaborate with antivirus vendors or provide clear instructions to users on whitelisting Pieces OS.
**Gather detailed user feedback:** Encourage users to provide detailed system information, logs, and steps to reproduce issues. This will help in faster diagnosis and resolution of problems.

**Consider a dedicated support channel for EAP features:** Given the number of issues related to the Long Term Memory (LTM) feature, which is currently in Early Access, consider creating a dedicated support channel or forum for users testing EAP features.

**Proactively monitor system performance:** Implement monitoring and analytics to proactively identify performance issues and trends in Pieces OS and Desktop App. This will help in addressing problems before they become widespread.

**Create a knowledge base or FAQ section:** Develop a comprehensive knowledge base or FAQ section addressing common issues, troubleshooting steps, and workarounds. This will empower users to resolve issues independently and reduce support ticket volume.

**Analyze ticket trends for continuous improvement:** Regularly analyze support ticket data to identify recurring issues, common pain points, and areas for improvement in the software, documentation, or support processes.
